page.title: 11Local History in Aboyne
page.content: {Local History: {Place Name}_ The name "Aboyne" is a compound of the Gaelic words "A", a ford, and "boinne" or "buinne", a current of rippling water, ie a ford across the River Dee, a little south of the church. {Historic Buildings}_ Aboyne{Castle}was built in 1400. It remained in the Gordon family until 1914. From then until 1937 it became derelict. It was then re_acquired by the Gordon family. The restoration to its present state began in 1974 and was completed in 1979. Since then it has been the home of the present Lord Aboyne. The castle is occupied all year. Part of the out buildings added in 1869 are used as garages. No additions have been made since the restoration. The castle is not open to the public as Lord Aboyne feels it is too small.
